full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### Formlabs Fuse1+ 30W 3D Printer or Equivalent
---

**Reference Number:** PW-23-01030580

**Amendments:** This solicitation is subject to amendments to the original set of tender documents. All amendments are available at [the link for the solicitation documents] <https://canadabuys.canada.ca> and must be considered for all bid responses.

**Request for Proposal:**
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites bids for the provision of a Formlabs Fuse1+ 30W 3D Printer or equivalent, along with installation, training, and maintenance services. The deliverables must be received on or before June 30, 2023.

**Security Requirements:**
The Contractor's resources will require a security clearance at the RCMP Facility Access Level 2 (FA2) with escort. This clearance will be verified by the Personnel Security Unit (PSU) of the RCMP.

**Basis of Selection:**
To be eligible for consideration, tenderers must meet all the requirements outlined in the bid solicitation. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for contract award.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
Tenders will be evaluated based on the mandatory technical criteria outlined in Attachment 1 to Part 4 of the Request for Proposal document.

**Indigenous Procurement:**
The RCMP encourages Indigenous businesses to participate in this procurement process. More information on Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) and Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Businesses can be found on the Government of Canada website at <https://www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory> .

**Procurement Office:**
The procurement office responsible for this project is the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) Procurement and Contracting Branch.

**Contact Us:**
For more information, please contact:
David Repsys  
E-mail: david.repsys@rcmp-grc.gc.ca  
Phone: 343-575-5298

---

**Government of Canada Acquisition Notice Policy**
The Government of Canada will make available Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP) and bid solicitations for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at [the link for the solicitation documents] <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities> . The Government of Canada will not assume any liabilities for the information found on websites of third parties. It is the bidder's responsibility to regularly consult GETS for the most up-to-date
